title: Final (ðŸ˜‚) part of the great JavaScript refactoring.
body:
Fixes #137.

This fundamentally changes how the results are displayed.

Originally the technique was to clear out and re-add content to a single div that's never removed from the DOM. Now, the #results div gets replaced many times with entirely new elements.

The benefit of doing it this way is that the code is much more reliable and it should be impossible to now get duplicate results (even though it shouldn't be possible after #162, but this is belt and braces). It also has the side effect of getting rid of the flickering of the results div that we were seeing when typing queries.

title: Clean up index.lock files
body:
Fixes #70 

There are quite a few commands that trip over existing `index.lock` files and it'd be tedious to instrument them all with a coping mechanism.

I think what's happening when an `index.lock` sticks around is that an analysis process gets interrupted midstream and then the next job can't proceed. So I think simply ensuring that we clean up stray files should be good enough.

title: Refactored opening external links in a blank target into a separate JS file
body: Part one of a few in the refactoring.

title: Logging
body:
Parking this for now. Grafana and Loki are running but promtail is not forwarding logs at the moment.

- the built-in config only picks up `/var/log` and doesn't get the container logs
- supplying a custom config works when I try it locally but fails to load on prod:
```
spi@localhost ~/SwiftPackageIndex-Server (logging)> docker logs spi_promtail_1
Unable to parse config: read /etc/promtail/promtail.yaml: is a directory
```
- the Loki docker plugin to allow forwarding without promtail doesn't work for some reason

I'm running docker-compose 1.25.5 on both systems, so it's not clear to me why one would map in the config file as a directory.

--

Fixed by baking in the config for now.

Fixes #152

title: Integrate CodeKit, and switched from using libraries imported from CDNs to CodeKit imported libraries.
body:
This does not include the refactoring but is the step needed before that can go ahead, so let's get it merged in so the refactor PR is not merged into this messy PR.

Several changes here:

* Moved to minification of JavaScript and CSS with CodeKit pre-processing files. There is no build folder, the whole process just builds and compiles to the same directory.
* Switched the markup to import *only* the combined/minified JavaScript and CSS.
* Migrated from JavaScript libraries loaded directly from a CDN, to manually importing from npm modules. This has the huge advantage of allowing us to *only* import the bits of a library that we actually need. This last step took the minified JavaScript from 88kb total to 18kb total. Amazing!

In order to run the app, no extra software is needed. If you want to change the JavaScript, you'll need to install [CodeKit](https://codekitapp.com).

title: Populate the "Recent Packages" and "Recent Releases" data
body:
- [x] create mat views for queries
- [ ] wire up queries in home page

The Recent Packages and Recent Releases lists on the home page need data.

## Recent Packages

This should be the last 10 (valid) packages ordered by created_at on the packages table. In other words, the last 10 packages that were added to the index.

## Recent Releases

The last 10 versions across all packages. Limited to be unique per package (so even if a package does two releases in quick succession, it's not listed twice).

title: Bug when running `git log` commands
body:
After the logging in #136 it's a little clearer that there's an error with the code to gather the history  metadata from git. When running against some repositories, there are errors like this:

```
[ ERROR ] analysis error: Shell command failed:
command: "git log -n1 --format=format:"%H-%ct" 0.1.0"
path:    "/Users/dave/Development/SwiftPackageIndex/Checkouts/github.com-fabianfett-vapor-lambda-runtime"
message: "ShellOut encountered an error
Status code: 128
Message: "fatal: ambiguous argument '0.1.0': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'"
Output: """
```

Running `git tag` on that repository shows the error clearly:

```
v0.1.0
v0.2.0
v0.3.0
```

The `v` is being omitted from the tag, probably as it's being stripped as it's not technically a valid version. We'll need to keep the original tag name around as well as the parsed semantic version.

Running the exact same command with the correct tag name works well:

```
git log -n1 --format=format:"%H-%ct" v0.1.0
```

Outputs:

```
8ecc257775d0567cf404287d2c7a40cee7d033d4-1579047775
```

title: Clean up and refactor JavaScript
body:
The JavaScript is getting out of control already!

* Split JavaScript into multiple source files and classes.
* Combine and minify the multiple source files when changing code.

title: Logging improvements
body:
Merge after #132 

Fixes #133 by adding a `ROLLBAR_LOG_LEVEL` env variable (defaulting to `critical` if unset), allowing us to manage the level externally. We're only reporting one critical error at the moment, so this will reign in errors we're reporting.

Fixes #135 

While it's hard to capture the package id or url without wrapping all shell.run calls in error handlers, it's quite simple to at least add the command and path to the existing exceptions. Give that most commands provide enough context from that alone, this should help us with debugging quite a bit. If we still need more, we can go in an wrap the areas where we're lacking detail.

title: Log Shellout errors in more detail
body: Dave's seeing an issue running git commands and it's impossible to tell which package is affected and which commands exactly is being run. Log those to the console.
